newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures tumble on long-liquidation.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures tumble on long-liquidation.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures ended sharply lower on Thursday, with the September and November contracts plunging by by their daily price limit at the close, due to heavy long-liquidation by local investors, traders said.
The daily limit to price fluctuations is 500 yen.
Prices ranged from 320 to 500 yen lower per tonne lower, with benchmark May 1998 closing 380 yen down at 14,800 yen.
The market started weaker as bearish sentiment carried over from Wednesday. During the day, prices extended losses as the yen's rise against the dollar prompted heavy long-liquidation, traders said.
"The market appeared to be more responsive to bearish factors," one trader said.
The spot May contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $2.88 per bushel at 0839 GMT, unchanged from the Wednesday close.
The spot May contract on CBOT soybean futures on the overnight trading system stood at $8.91-1/2 at 0839 GMT, down from the Wednesday close of $8.96.
